data.name: Dividend Basics
data.text: Dividends are payments made by companies to their shareholders as a reward for owning their stock. Dividend stocks can be a good way to generate passive income and can be less risky than growth stocks. However, not all companies pay dividends, and dividend payments are not guaranteed.

questions.text: Why are dividend stocks less risky than growth stocks?
Are all companies required to pay dividends?

data.name: Dividend Reinvestment
data.text: Dividend reinvestment plans (DRIPs) allow shareholders to automatically reinvest their dividend payments into additional shares of the same stock, often at a discount. DRIPs can help investors to compound their returns over time and can be a good way to invest small amounts of money on a regular basis. However, DRIPs can also be subject to fees and taxes.

questions.text: What is a potential advantage of using a DRIP?
Are DRIPs subject to fees and taxes?
